actionparsnip: yes: first hit Ctrl+Alt+t and you type ifconfig in the window that comes up and hit enter, what does it say (paste it on http://paste.ubuntu.com/ and paste the link you get on there here)
then, in the same window type nslookup www.google.com and paste to the same place what you get
is your laptop supposed to use a wireless card or a network cable
when you type ifconfig and hit enter you should get a listing made of at least two parts each of them starting with a name like lo, or wlan0 or eth0
what is it written after inet address: =
is there written inet address at all?
does your /etc/resolv.conf file list any nameserver x.x.x.x lines?

it's a file which contains the address of a computer which translates every name you type when you go on the Internet (a name like www.google.com) into an IP address, which is the thing your computer understands
in the command window type ping -c 5 8.8.8.8
and hit enter
is the computer your using being connected to the Internet in the same way as your laptop?
type route -N to the command window
what does it say?
yes, you should look for a line with Destination 0.0.0.0, Gateway x.x.x.x
can you ping 192.168.0.1
is 192.168.0.1 the IP address of your router?
can you ping yourself?
do you have a firewall (you check with iptable -L)
